means: 月桂树( laurel的名词复数 )

sentence.Network_en: The path was lined with laurels.
sentence.Network_cn: 小路两旁都种有月桂树.

sentence.Network_en: The government can't rest on its laurels and must press ahead with major policy changes.
sentence.Network_cn: 政府不能故步自封，必须继续大刀阔斧地推行政策改革。

sentence.Network_en: The committee's chairman accused NASA of resting on its laurels after making it to the moon.
sentence.Network_cn: 委员会主席指责美国国家航空航天局成功登月之后便志得意满，不思进取。

PerfectNetExp.abs: He won the regional laurels and went on to his finals ., 他获得地区冠军后参加决赛.
He has never rested on his laurels ., 他从不满足目前的成就.
we cannot rest on our laurels ; we must forge ahead ., 我们不能停留在现有的成绩上 , 要继续前进.
The resourceful jurist formed a plan to recover his laurels ., 足智多谋的法学家已经想出了一个恢复名誉的计策.

劳莱(Stan Laurel)，电影喜剧演员，生于英国，以“劳莱与哈台”闻名。　　麦克琳托克(Barbara McClintock) 美国植物遗传学家，81岁时 …
化学专业词汇_汉英_ ... lactide 交酯 laurel oil 月桂油 le chatelier braun's principle 勒.

entry.def: A laurel or a laurel tree is a small evergreen tree with shiny leaves. The leaves are sometimes used to make decorations such as wreaths.
If someone is resting on their laurels, they appear to be satisfied with the things they have achieved and have stopped putting effort into what they are doing.

example.ex: The committee's chairman accused NASA of resting on its laurels after making it to the moon...
example.tran: 委员会主席指责美国国家航空航天局成功登月之后便志得意满，不思进取。

example.ex: The government can't rest on its laurels and must press ahead with major policy changes.
example.tran: 政府不能故步自封，必须继续大刀阔斧地推行政策改革。

means.word_mean: 1. a tangible symbol signifying approval or distinction;
3. (antiquity) wreath of laurel foliage worn on the head as an emblem of victory

auth_sentence.content: Gould knows he can't rest on his laurels.

auth_sentence.content: The Irish might take umbrage at such perceived laurels.
auth_sentence.res_content: The Irish might take umbrage at such perceived laurels.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The Irish might take umbrage at such perceived laurels.

auth_sentence.content: Morningstar, meanwhile, isn't resting on its laurels.
